question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Epoch boundary handling] During epoch transitions when validator set changes, can sharded execution handle incomplete cross-shard messages safely without losing transaction results? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Remote executor authentication] In RemoteExecutorClient implementations, can malicious remote shards impersonate legitimate executor shards and inject false execution results? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Network partition resilience] If network partitions isolate some executor shards, can the coordinator detect this and safely abort execution, or will it hang waiting for results? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Serialization attacks] Can malicious executors send malformed serialized TransactionOutput objects that cause deserialization errors or memory corruption in the coordinator? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Transaction abort handling] Can shards incorrectly handle transaction aborts (e.g., Move aborts, out-of-gas) by including partial state changes in TransactionOutput? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Signature verification bypass] Can sharded execution skip signature verification assuming it was done earlier, allowing unsigned transactions to be executed if injected after partitioning? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Sequence number validation] Can race conditions in parallel shard execution cause sequence number violations (e.g., same sequence number executed twice) to go undetected? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Account creation conflicts] If multiple shards attempt to create the same account in parallel, can both succeed causing multiple account creation events for the same address? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Module publishing conflicts] Can conflicting Move module publications in different shards both succeed, causing module versions to diverge across validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Transaction fee calculation] Can sharded execution produce inconsistent transaction fee calculations across shards, causing validator reward distribution to diverge? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [State proof generation] Can sharded execution generate invalid state proofs if the Merkle tree is updated inconsistently across shards? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Reconfiguration event handling] Can shards mishandle reconfiguration events (e.g., validator set changes, feature flag updates) causing execution to proceed with stale configuration? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Table operations] Can concurrent table operations (table::add, table::borrow_mut) across shards violate Move's borrow checker rules and cause undefined behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Object ownership] Can sharded execution violate Move object ownership rules by allowing multiple shards to mutate the same object concurrently? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Resource account creation] Can Byzantine shards bypass resource account validation to create resource accounts without proper authorization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Coin minting] Can incorrect cross-shard aggregation of coin operations allow double-minting of APT tokens? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Stake operations] Can parallel execution of staking operations across shards cause incorrect validator stake calculations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Governance voting] Can sharded execution allow the same governance vote to be counted multiple times if executed in different shards? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Timestamp consistency] Can shards use inconsistent block timestamps during execution, causing time-dependent operations to produce different results across validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Storage quota enforcement] Can sharded execution fail to properly enforce per-account storage quotas, allowing accounts to exceed limits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Event key conflicts] Can multiple shards generate events with the same event key and sequence number, violating event uniqueness? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Move VM version] Can different shards execute with different Move VM versions, causing bytecode interpretation differences and state divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Speculative execution] Can speculative execution in Block-STM cause transaction results to differ based on whether speculation succeeded, breaking determinism? (High)
